intro: Biscutella laevigata subsp. varia, commonly known as the smooth biscuitroot, is a low-growing perennial plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many economically important flowering plants. The plant features small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in racemes, and its leaves are typically oval to lance-shaped with a smooth texture. It thrives in rocky or gravelly soils and is often found in alpine or arctic environments. Due to its hardy nature, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
